description: This course introduces computer programming to biologists and allows for the creative application
of this skill to an array of biological questions, with an emphasis on advanced genetics topics.
From mining large genetic sequence databases to simulating population dynamics, we explore how
computational tools are becoming essential to the study of a broad range of biological systems.
Students participate in a semester-long project that allows them to sequence and publish their own
DNA and analyze their evolutionary history. Counts toward biomolecular science and mathematical
